Posts.Content: Hi Guys, PSA has gone from 11.42 Jan. 2017 to what it is now 132.02 June 2017. Was on Xtandi for a few years, went to Zytiga which did absolutely nothing. Have been on double Degarelix shots to get Testosterone down. Which it did get it down into 20's but seems too little too late on that. Started Xofigo in March. Have done 4 shots of that...no real problems. Anyway, my oncologist would like me to stop the Xofigo, and start Taxotere immediately. I'm inclined to do the 2 more shots of Xofigo, and see where we are at that point. I didn't expect the Xofigo to drop my PSA (of course I was hoping), but I did expect it to control it somewhat. I just don't like the idea of stopping in mid stream. I have been able to keep my prostate cancer known to only my close friends & family. My physical appearance has not changed in 5 1/2 years of some form of ADT. I never wanted to be defined by my illness. Of course, once I start Taxotere and my hair falls away.....the cat is out of the bag. I know it's in my future, but would like to stay away from it as long as possible. My Onc has no other options according to her. Any input would be welcome..... Thanks guys
Posts.Signature: Born Feb. 3rd 1947 68 Diagnosed March, 2012 10 of 16 cores samples Pos. Gleason 8 PSA 14.717 Shot of Firmagon April 2012 Started Lupron May 2012 45 Radiation treatments July/August 2012 PSA went to a low of .38 in Feb. 2013, started to rise after that to a high of 1.69 in Dec 2013, put on Casodex with the Lupron Psa went to a low of 0.08 in June 2014 started to rise to 0.93 on Feb 11 2015 Update to follow
Posts.Title: Xofigo/Taxotere

Posts.Content: Thanks Dave, Excuse my being naive. But, not sure what RO or MO is. I've had two CT Scans & Bone Imaging this year....showing some progression of bone mets. I also had radiation to my right acetabulum (5 rounds) which showed a slight decrease in extent of uptake as of 6-27-17. They just seem too anxious to put me on Taxotere for awhile now.
Posts.Title: Xofigo/Taxotere

Posts.Content: Thanks Fairwind, I have been thinking about a orchiectomy for awhile now, as my guys or so small won't miss them anyway. I will look into TRANSFORMER, never heard of that one. Also could you elaborate on "reset" of Xtandi. I have been off it for awhile now, and I have been thinking of going back on it just to see if it will help. (I still have a small stockpile) They have never brought up Provenge. Any advice is greatly appreciated.... Thanks P.S. I'm 70 and still work.....enjoy still being in the game.

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, Anyone on Xtandi experience back issues? I would not call it pain, just discomfort. Seems worse at night when laying down. Right now on Xtandi/Xofigo (5) and double shot of Degarelix to keep testoterone down. PSA right now 153 up from 132 last month. Med onc is dying to put me on Taxotere...i'd like to put that off until Nov. there are a few things I would like to do before that. Thanks guys....... Rob

Posts.Title: Starting Docetaxel

Posts.Content: I've been on it for about 3 years now...one thing I do, I make sure I get a good nights sleep. If I don't drink any liquids after 8, I can usually sleep thru the night. So, that done I know I have no excuse of not enough sleep. I still work...although part-time now, but it gives me something to do. I am needed also on my job..which motivates me. I exercise, walk alot, and basically curl 10lb weights until my arms hurt. I was on Lupron/Casodex, so I can't speak for the drugs your dad is taking. Also, I noticed a big difference in what I could do between my 60-65th birthdays, before I even had PCa....so I think age does have to be a bit of a factor. I KNOW i'm not 50 anymore! And your dad has been on a long road....I would imagine how mentally tiring that can be. All the best.. Rob
Posts.Title: Lupron seemingly causing Fatigue, possible solutions?
